posts.title: Spring Boot 3 Docker Compose Support
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: We will have a look at the new Spring Boot 3.1 feature supporting Docker Compose files on startup. No need to start Docker compose separately again

posts.title: Spring Cloud AWS 3.0 S3 with Spring Boot and Localstack
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: In this article, we will look into how we can use Spring Cloud AWS S3 in a Spring Boot Application to communicate with AWS. We will run our setup with LocalStack to mock the actual AWS S3 service

posts.title: Distributed Tracing With OpenTelemetry and Jaeger In Spring Boot 3
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: In this article, we will look at how we can export distributed traces using Opentelemetry to Jaeger from a Spring Boot Application

posts.title: Spring Boot With MongoDB Using Spring Data
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: In this article, we will look at how we can start a local MongoDB instance using Docker and then communicate with it using a Spring Boot Application

posts.title: FIDO2 Passwordless Authentication With Keycloak - Part 2
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: In this article, we will explore how we can implement FIDO2 passwordless authentication using Keycloak.

posts.title: FIDO2 Passwordless Authentication With Keycloak - Part 1
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: In this article we will look into understanding how FIDO2 passwordless authentication works

posts.title: Kick Start Spring Boot On AWS Lambda with Snap Start
posts.author: Amrut Prabhu
posts.summary: We will look into how we can create an AWS Lambda with Terraform and run a Spring Boot application to view its performance with the Snap Start option enabled

initialDisplayPosts.author: Amrut Prabhu
initialDisplayPosts.summary: In this article we will look into understanding how FIDO2 passwordless authentication works

initialDisplayPosts.title: Kick Start Spring Boot On AWS Lambda with Snap Start
initialDisplayPosts.author: Amrut Prabhu
initialDisplayPosts.summary: We will look into how we can create an AWS Lambda with Terraform and run a Spring Boot application to view its performance with the Snap Start option enabled
